Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, central”
Reviews.Author: isaari
Reviews.Content: Met expectations and while small, the rooms are very well appointed and very comfortable. We had room 78 (corner room) which offered a great view of Union Square and Nob Hill. Staff was welcoming and helpful and being so accessible to Muni and cable cars made this a great spot for the money. We'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem for the Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: Hazel W
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel, a small Personality chain hotel, located just north and west of Union Square. Location, location, location. But it's more than that. The hotel is a union hotel and its employees, many of whom have been there for years, take enormous pride in the place. This is no Ian Schrager beautiful people place. This is a hotel that takes pride in caring for an eccentric building, old fashioned furnishings, but comfortable beds, really comfortable beds, nice toiletries, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,charming hotel , Superior staff attention”
Reviews.Author: SallyAustr
Reviews.Content: I would like to leave a very favourable review for Kensington Park Hotel. I have been staying in Personality Hotel Group Hotels for a number of years. I have stayed at this particular property 3 times each time for 3 weeks. The location is excellent. The lasting impression however is the staff. Their professionalism and efficiency while always maintaining a smile even when dealing with jetlagged ,exhausted, often irritable guests like me ,ensures a loyalty to them in return. I can't rate this hotel highly enough. I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tripp8400
Reviews.Content: just spent the last 3 days in SF and couldn't have been happier about our choice of Hotels. Great location with a friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very quaint and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stop on Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RachnBran
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days in Napa we traveled to San Francisco. I booked this hotel off of the Trip Advisor reviews I had read and was happy I did. The location for the hotel was great, right in the middle of everything, and the hotel staff was very nice. The rooms were a little small and the bathrooms were outdated but overall it was clean and was perfect for the 2 of us and out bag.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: ham382
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on vacation, great location. Smart hotel with clean rooms. If you're visiting and want to stay in the heart of town this is close to the shops and several good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Guillermina G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated, the money you pay is worth it. All the staff were really eager to help. We have stayed here for six days, and the room was always clean. It is very handy to be close to Macy's (You know...shopping time). Thanks to TripAdvisor's reviews I have chosen this hotel. The only problem was three days with bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfectly situated.”
Reviews.Author: dczegers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to save some money over my expensive conference hotel. I loved the location. But even tho it was downtown (and St Patrick's Day), my room was very quiet. I loved the perfectly made tea that is offered throughout the day in the lobby. Such a welcome treat when coming back tired to the hotel. There was also sherry and music in the lobby in the evenings. The staff was friendly. My room was nice, the bathroom was a teensy bit outdated but this was billed as a European hotel so I didn't mind!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring your own toiletries!”
Reviews.Author: Bocagrlz
Reviews.Content: We got into San Francisco about an hour before check-in. I had called ahead and requested a quiet room due to past reviews read on Trip Advisor. The desk clerk indicated that the hotel was full to capacity and that we'd need to wait until 3pm to check in. As we walked away with our bags he said that he 'just found' a room on a high, quiet floor that we could go to immediately, however there would be an extra $20/day with tax. The only upgrade to the room was 'better bedding', as he put it. We agreed to take the room, as we were tired from the long flight from the east coast. The room was satisfactory and appeared to be in the middle of a renovation, nice bedding, newly tiled bathroom, however the carpets looked original to the 1920's building and the baseboards were all scuffed and dirty. We settled in for a good nights sleep and were awakened each morning at 5:45a.m. to the clanking of coffee cups and pouring water in buckets by housekeeping - as their closet was just outside our door. So much for sleeping in..... Oh, and do bring your own toiletries. Two of us shared one tiny bottle of shampoo for three days. On the third day I called the front desk and asked them if they did not replentish toiletries and he said that he would send someone from housekeeping up right away. In about five minutes there was a knock at the door and an older man stood there and barged past me and said 'I want to see'. He proceeded to brush past me and went into the bathroom to 'see for himselft that we were out of soap and shampoo'. He left and came back with a sack of two items each and shoved it at me and said 'will this be enough'? Wow, that's never happened to me at a hotel before. Made me wish that we'd used out Marriott points and stayed there with our executive privileges. We tipped the maid everyday generously, so I didn't see what the big deal was about toiletries. On the bright side the hotel was close to Union Square. The entire property looked like it needed a good cleaning. They need to send their employees to a concierge school to learn how to treat guests. I would not stay here again. I've stayed many times at the Chancellor (boutique hotel), the Cartwright and the Drake, all of which offer better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: KarlosPerth
Reviews.Content: Would recommend and would stay again if ever back in San Fran

Reviews.Title: “An excellent central SF hotel - distinctive and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Mick_D_WYorks
Reviews.Content: On business in San Francisco and missed the so-called 'reduced rate' rooms at the conference hotel near the Moscone Centre. I then took it as a challenge to get 4-star accommodation downtown for sub-$200 a night.The Kensington Park did not disappoint on any level. My room was clean, spacious and had a very comfortable bed. Decor might appear slightly dated or in need of refreshement to some eyes, but this is clearly a period building - an overtly modern style would not be sympathetic. Staff were friendly, positive and always helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel. It is very well located for all the downtown attractions of Union Square, Powell-Hyde cable car, Market St. In fact that was my one grumble - the presence of only single glazing in the window made for intrusive noise in late evening, up to 10-11 pm. Resolved I was told by requesting a room on the "Nob Hill side". I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but interesting hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, but the rooms seemed to be in good condition and the place certainly has a lot of character. Staff was friendly. Place was clean. I actually emjoyed my stay - so much more interesting that all those new box hotels. The price was certainly reasonable and the location quite central to Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, room facilities could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Razzi-B
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly & helpful. The location is great for down town San Francisco. The rooms are furnished in an old traditional way & the furnishings are fine, as is the room size. However, with no restuarant in the hotel & no mini bar in the room they could at least add a complimentary bottle of drinking water each day! They also need to add safe deposit boxes. The windows are very old & leaky so street noise can be bad. And finally, the valet service needs to be faster. A few little improvements would turn this from average to great.

Reviews.Title: “An Oldie But A Goldie.”
Reviews.Author: AngusDiver
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park is located in an old building which is well preserved and well maintained. The rooms are pretty large and equipped with good quality fittings and a comfortable bed. The views however leave a little to be desired; purely looking out over the scruffy roofs of other buildings. The hotel is located just off Union Square and is very handy for the cable car so it's easy to move around using public transport. It's also very handy for numerous eaters if you don't want to travel far. It's also pretty close to Chinatown which you can walk through to get down to the harbour area and the piers. Great hotel and area - pity about the views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve60993
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old, but very well-maintained. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable, bathrooms have been renovated and showers are nice. Great location, half a block from Union Square. Can't beat the location. prices are reasonable for this area. Service is excellent. We stayed here for 6 days and had a great experience. only negative is no exercise room, but you get complimentary use of a small exercise area in a hotel about a block away. This exercise room is tiny with minimal equipment. There is a Club One (full gym with lap pool) a block away for $20 a day. other than the exercise room, or lack thereof, this is a very nice hotel. Would definitely stay here again when visiting San Fran. overall great value

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbie1976
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park Hotel is in a perfect central location in San Francisco - we had 4 nights here before picking up a hire car and embarking on a bit of a roadtrip of Yosemite, Kings Canyon, Death Valley and Grand Canyon. The rooms weren't particularly large but were more than big enough for our requirements and had a lovely bathroom. The hotel has lots of character and charm and has a very cosy feel. Staff were helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Think, Just Book!”
Reviews.Author: Zels
Reviews.Content: Great little Boutique hotel very centrally located, right off Union Square. Very Charming. The staff is wonderfully accomodating. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side but not uncomfortably so. My only feedback would be to ask for a room on the Nob Hill side. We spent the first night on the street side and it was pretty loud. We moved for the 2nd and 3rd night and had a great view of the Huntington Hotel that the beautiful cathedral. Price, location, charm....you wont be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in central location. Staff were very nice and gave good recommendations when asked. The water was off for 6 hours on one of the days there but it did not affect us as we were out all that day and they gave good notice. The water in the shower was hard to regulate at right temperature at first but was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Iffy stay”
Reviews.Author: la2nj
Reviews.Content: I made reservations here based on the many positive reviews that I'd read here. I wasn't expecting a modern, luxury room and had previously stayed in other older hotels in the downtown area, so I had reasonable expectations. Our check-in was late due to plane delays. We were assigned to a very small room that had an entrance inside an alcove which made it awkward for rolling in the luggage. The room was very dark when all of the lights were turned on and did not have adequate space for unpacking two suitcases. Upon entering, the room was quite cold as the thermostat was off; but the heater did not work at all even when turned on for more than ten minutes. I called down to the front desk and was informed that I could come downstairs to get keys for another room, but there did not seem to be anyone available to check it out. We changed to a room down the hallway which was a bit larger (which then made me wonder why we weren't assigned there initially). This room was more comfortable; but the heat couldn't be adjusted when on, so we had to keep the window open a bit. This made us more susceptible to street noise which sounded like clanging trash bins being collected at night. I didn't mind the small size of the bathroom which was plentifully stocked with toiletries including toothpaste, but the height of the sink vanity was quite low. The alarm on the clock radio malfunctioned the next morning, and we overslept to find no hot water available. TV reception was limited to local stations. The biggest asset of the hotel is its location. The lobby is charming. In the morning there was coffee available, and in the afternoon there were live musicians playing during tea and sherry service. The business center had computers and printer for free guest use. I am unsure whether or not I'd give this place another try. It would depend upon cost and availability of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Intriguing”
Reviews.Author: DDTSarasota
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lobby has history and charm, with a elegant chandelier, grand piano, glamorous carved wood ceiling and intriguing artwork. The front desk staff, concierge, housekeeping staff were kind, friendly and professional. The rooms were cozy, comfortable and extremely clean. The bathroom slightly small but adequate. The shower was awesome, had wonderful water pressure for a nice hot shower. The beds, bedding and pillows were very nice and extremely cozy. Our family of 3 couples enjoyed staying here for 2 nights. We had dinner close by at Fino's, which was fabulous. We had a nice breakfast around the corner at Sears Fine Food, which was also very good. Highly recommend this hotel near Union Square for location, value and charm!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. It is situated right next to Union square - literally a 50m walk at most! This is it's biggest selling point! Union square in all reality, is the best place to stay in San Francisco. Being close to Powell St as well, you are very close to a couple of cable car stops as well (essential for getting to Fishermans Wharf and great fun to ride). There is a Walgreens just around the corner (supermarket) which is also handy. As you walk out the doors of the hotel, to your right are 2 little sandwich / delis (both before you get to the street corner). Both are fantastic for breakfast, lunch or a meal. Highly recommend them. Well priced and very tasty food. They are small places, but are great. Sears is also just around the corner on Powell St which is an institution in SFran. We were told the breakfast was great, but only ended up going to dinner there. Quite a decent more "home cooked" American style meal that won't break the bank. The hotel itself is quaint. It is an old style hotel but still looks in good condition. The check in staff are very friendly and the concierge (Ron) is brilliant! The hotel has an ATM in the foyer - was not expecting this for a boutique hotel. There are also major bank ATMs just around the corner on Powell as well. There are no in-room safes (bit of a negative as the closets are big enough to have one) - so on check in make sure you ask for a check in desk safe as they can run out. Also, no small fridge (seriously, all hotels should have one for the convenience of their customers and not have to pay extra for it - in Australia and Asia, I have yet been to a hotel that does not have one!). Wifi is free - which is great! We found in too many hotels in US that we had to pay for Wifi ;( The room is compact but not like the tiny European hotel rooms. For a week stay, it was comfortable. The bed was good. The bathroom - needs renovation. It does not have to be massive, but the taps and shower heads need to be replaced - as they are getting old. The restaurant next door (the Farallon) - don't bother. It is overpriced and the service is (well at least what we experienced), very poor. If I were to come to San Francisco again, I would definitely stay here. Location is perfect and the hotel is very good and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: WAussie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights mid January and really enjoyed our stay Very comfortable with the little extras that help you enjoy your stay. Concierge was great,very helpful Bathroom was small but had everything you needed Room was very clean had a great walkin closet to tuck the suitcases in for extra room Location is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “good value/excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shivkp
Reviews.Content: good experience with this hotel in the heart of union square... literally across 1 block lies mace's and saks. the rates are favourable compared to other hotels in the area. Highly recommended for good value mid to upper scale hotel. friendly concierge in bob at the front desk!! would come back here to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Joanna1333
Reviews.Content: The bed was the BEST part. We upgraded to the room with the down bedding--very warm and comfortable. The room was also very clean. One very minor glitch was that our room was not ready at 3:00 which is the check-in time, but we waited in the very comfortable lobby for about 30 minutes where they have tea available; there was supposed to be sherry but I didn't see that. Great location near the Macy's in Union Square--so pretty at Christmas time! Would definitely go back, we felt like it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “we checked out without even staying”
Reviews.Author: Volunteer6026
Reviews.Content: To be honest this hotel may suit some people but we had just come from the Bellagio and to this standard of hotel it just didnt compare but even though it was not the standard we were expecting so we went up the road to the Marriott - lovely there was three of us and the beds are so small along with the rooms that all out suitcases didnt even fit in the room and you could leave them open as there was not where to walk?? It is old but has character and again if it was for one of two people at the most per room it would be ok, but too small for three adults

Reviews.Title: “Location, ambiance, and service-- This place has it all~!”
Reviews.Author: Meghan S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing~! The staff is so nice and helpful, the lobby had great maps and travel guides for the city, there was tea and sherry in the lobby (so fancy~!), and the rooms were so beautiful and comfy. The hotel is sooo close to Union Square and all the shopping! Loved it, boyfriend and I HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Marrti
Reviews.Content: This is called a good deal: affordable, cute, old fashion but very classy hotel with friendly and helpful personnel in a heart of Union Square, with short distance to famous historic trams and Market Street, and China Town around the corner make it a fantastic location.The hotel doesn't provide breakfast but you can get complimentary cup of tea and glass of sherry in the afternoon. There is a plenty of dinning options in the neighborhood including funky restaurant with jelly fish lamps only next door from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LewisCox50
Reviews.Content: We booked this with a great rate from book it .com. Hotel is nicely presented and even though we arrived late we received a warm welcome although had to handle our own luggage to room minor gripe but these things do make a difference. Room was very clean and well laid out with an en suite bathroom with plenty of towelles and quality toiletries. To sum up KP Hotel is like being wrapped in a warm blanket by an old freind and makes you feel warm, valued and welcome. It does not pretend to be five star and it is not but it is a dam good three star and I would return in a heart beat. Thank you Bob for your advice about local places to eat and how to get where !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value-for-money property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stelle-89
Reviews.Content: We chose this property due to it's location near Union Square, and also the fantastic price. The room was gorgeous, as were all the parts of the hotel we saw. It is kind of budget luxury, there were a few things that wouldn't happen in a 5-star hotel (which this does not claim to be) but for the price you pay, it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa w
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of everything! Just off Union Square (we even had a view of the ice skating rink) it is the ideal location for tourists and shoppers alike. It is a boutique hotel with 5 star service. From check in to check out, the staff was extremely accommodating, so friendly and wonderful with our kids. Rooms are updated with SF chic style. Cannot be beat for the value in a big city, have stayed here often. Best deal in town, by far.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: lovnlifeonearth
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend here while attending two very special events. The location was perfect! The room was very comfortable. The people were wonderful. The BED was SO cozy! Our room was on the 11th floor with a view of Nob Hill, and fresh GOOD coffee (we like ours strong and tasty) was served every morning on that floor, near our room. Thai and the other people there made us feel very special. We really couldn't have asked for a better place to stay while enjoying downtown SF and attending a very special wedding. We will definitely come back... The only thing we would improve is the toilet.. it was small and short.... and the lighting in the bathroom (a little dim). Construction at the entrance wasn't very attractive, but that is temporary and will be probably be beautiful when it is finished. Loved the artsy life size horse in the lobby. No afternoon sherry while we were there.. a disappointment. Everything else was heavenly. Be sure to have breakfast next door at the Cafe La Taza. GOOD food at the right price - FRESH orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “No full length mirror.”
Reviews.Author: Mcscience
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights and found it to be clean, quiet, and comfortable. Yes, it's a tiny bit shabby (there were chips in formica in the bathroom and on the desk) but who really cares about that? The location and the price are right. And free wi-fi is fast enough. The coffee is brewed to my liking. Tea and sherry in the afternoon. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “It'll do in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: NEHudson
Reviews.Content: With the other options available in the area at comparable pricing, I'll look elsewhere next time. Location is very good for shopping and dining, but the staff was more interested in chatting amongst themselves than assisting guests.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TangyTexas
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay here and we look forward to our next visit in May. We love the Kensington Park Hotel. The lobby with its soaring wood beamed ceiling is beautiful. Hot tea and lemon water are available there all day with sherry added in the afternoon. The rooms are very attractive with heavenly beds. Our view at night of the lights on Nob Hill was a bonus. The staff is courteous and extremely helpful. The best part is location, location, location and at a very reasonable price. We were only steps from Union Square, terrific restaurants, great shopping, theaters, and special events. You will love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Old style-Modern decor-Small rooms-Great service!”
Reviews.Author: cindywho24
Reviews.Content: Oh! We felt so at home here. Our first night arrival was welcomed by the front desk and concierge by announcing their first names and let us know if we can assist you. We entered our very small two doubles room. But let me tell you how cozy and comfortable it has been. The bathroom is large but tight in the bedroom area. The beds are oh so comfortable and cozy. Pillow top mattresses with 3 pillows and more in the closet if you need them. Plenty of dresser & closet space for two for a 5 day trip. No AC...yikes. Not to worry-the nicest little Asian man in housekeeping was very accommodating with 2 fans. He had been upstairs earlier to turn on the heat for other patrons! Ha! No AC was no problem. It was plenty cool with fans and the window open. Our view of tall architectural old buildings and the fog was so awesome! It would have been nice to have coffee in our room but 1 floor up it's available with hot tea. We chose hot tea-coffee was too strong for our liking. Concierge has been very helpful! We will never forget the little Asian guy in housekeeping. So genuine and accommodating! Location was excellent! We walked and took cable cars everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: jazzabeller
Reviews.Content: We have already done our booking online prior to arrival in SF. For the first 2 nights, we were staying at another hotel. Before we moved, we decided to check out Kensington Park Hotel. We were greeted at the reception by Joshua. When we requested to see the Deluxe King Room, he gladly brought us up to not 1, but 2 rooms having different views from the room. I was impressed by his friendilness and customer service and was happy we have booked 5 nights in this hotel. We checked in at noon the next day and was happy to know the room was ready. (Check-in time was 3pm). The room looked exactly as the pictures posted and was cosy. I loved the fur blanket on the bed, which gives it a very luxurious feeling. I requested for a foam pillow 3 times from the hotel staff before someone got back to me and say that they are not available. I was quite annoyed by that. They need to work on staff communication and follow up of customer's request. Complimentary wifi was a dream and connection was fast except for 1 night which had technical issues. Complimentary tea and Sherry served each evening from 4-6pm in the lobby. Location was very good with Saks at Fifth Ave down the street and Macy's (Cheesecake factory on the 8th floor) just 1 block down. Lots of restaurants and cafe nearby and 2 Walgreens for your daily neccessities. For good value and delicious Thai food, try Bangkok just down the street. Hotel staff were quite knowledgeable and helpful with the exception of 1 male staff which I thought could do better with his curt attitude. For those who are engaging the hotel's service for a shuttle airport van (US$15 per person), do note that the hotel charge an extra service fee of US$5 per person. When we booked it with the help of the concierge, we were not informed of this additional cost. So we felt quite annyoed with the hidden cost. Overall we had a good experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Allison M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kensington Park Hotel for the last 4 nights of our honeymoon. The staff was very helpful with our bags, suggestions of what to do, and providing us with champagne glasses, etc. when we asked. We stayed on the 10th floor in a corner suite and the view was great. There was some city noise, but nothing outrageous. The room was comfortable and clean, although the bathroom could use some refurbishment and the selection of cable channels as well as the quailty of the signal has some room for improvement. The complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings was nice, although make sure to stop by Cafe la Taza a couple doors down to get a freshly cooked breakfast. The hotel is within walking distance to the cable car and BART, and of course Union Square. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabo!”
Reviews.Author: flossygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of our 2 month stay in the USA. It started out beautifully. We like good quality hotels (and who doesn't). The Kensington Park was recommended and although we preferred another hotel the price was right so we took our chances. So glad we did! The place was spotless and everything was within a stones throw. The rooms were stylish, bed to die for and the complimentary tea/sherry was a lovely touch at the end of the day after a hard day slogging the pavement! The staff were so friendly as well. We got this hotel for a song through hotwire.com. Would I stay here again, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, just off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Jessica T
Reviews.Content: Although we visit San Francisco on a very regular basis, we hadn't stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel in the past. I'm very picky about where we stay since I've had some terrible hotel experiences in the past at supposedly "upscale" hotels. I'm happy to report that the Kensington Park provided a fantastic stay over five nights. We checked in late and there were no issues. I'd had to create two separate reservations in advance since we added a night onto our stay after I'd made the first reservation and when I went back into the system to extend it, the room type I'd booked wasn't available for the extra night. However, when we checked in, they not only gave us the corner king room I'd originally booked, but they gave us that night at the same rate as I'd booked for the lesser room. The hotel is older, but it's got a ton of character (in a good way). It was *extremely* clean and the staff was *extremely* friendly. The bed was fantastic - so comfortable, to the point where I actually slept in late a few mornings. The bathroom was small, but well-appointed, with a hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, toothpaste and makeup remover towelettes provided. The view was fantastic - the corner king rooms have windows on two walls, so we overlooked Nob Hill on one side and Union Square on the other. There's a coffee maker in the room, but they also provide coffee and orange juice mid-way down the hall, and coffee, tea and water in the lobby in the morning. The location is good - just off Union Square, although they were doing major sidewalk work outside the entrance. It was about a five-10 minute walk from the Powell St. BART station, and there are lots of restaurants very close by, including one of the best seafood restaurants in the city that's literally connected to the lobby of the hotel (they have great happy hour deals on fresh oysters and drinks). The only minor detail is that there's no heater in the room; since we visited in November and it was cold/rainy for half of our trip, the room got pretty cold, although you could call and have a heater brought up to you. However, the bed was so warm that once I got into it, the need for a heater was gone. In fact, the first night we were there, we slept with the windows cracked and we were totally fine. Would we stay there again? Yes, absolutely. The Kensington Park is a charming hotel with friendly staff, great amenities (free wifi!) and a good location. It's hard to find such a great hotel in San Francisco at a decent price and in such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional interior & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: corus1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Sept 2011 for 8 nights with my sister. She had e-mailed ahead to tell them I was celebrating my 40th birthday. On arrival they had upgraded us to a twin corner room on the 11th floor, with views of Union Square (along with a complimentary bottle of red wine). The room was a good size, but the bathroom would benefit from some refurbishment. The hotel staff were excellent - really helpful with all of our questions & nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend this hotel for the superb location to Union Square (only 30 seconds walk to the nearest cable car stop). All in all, this hotel offered everything we expected with a little bit of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: spunksmunks
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, comfortable beds, pillows, wonderful location! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in heart of SF with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TnTWalter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Asked for a quiet room with a queen bed and we received a quiet room with a queen bed. Room was ready when we arrived at noon. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I expected the room to be small and it was but very manageable. Loved the decor and the marble shower. I would stay here again. Also, received an excellent rate on lastminutetravel for the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Review 15 Years in the Making!”
Reviews.Author: WrightKross
Reviews.Content: I just ran across the TripAdvisor listing for the Kensington Park Hotel and had to share a memory with the rest of my TripAdvisor family. (FYI -- this is not a recent review) I started dating my wife in April of 1996. In September, we made our first trip together as a couple, and decided on San Francisco as a destination. I had contacted my travel agent and told him I wanted something romantic, close to everything and reasonably priced. He asked if I needed anything else and I suggested either a violinist or spanish guitar player in a courtyard playing up to her in the evenings. While the musicians never materialized, everything else was met to perfection with his booking of the Kensington Park for us. Upon check-in, we were told that our travel agent had gotten us an upgrade. We took our keys and headed up to our floor. As I walked down the hallway, I read the room numbers, looking room #920: 912, 914, 916... the last two doors were marked "Presidential Suite." "No way," I thought and tried the key. The door opened on about 2000 square feet of opulence: lead crystal chandelier above the 12 person dining table, two full bathrooms with jacuzzi's, a reading/music area and an oversized king bed on a pedestal sitting four feet off the floor, with a control panel on the wall for the fireplace, television, lights and curtains! Wow! The staff at the Kensington was nothing short of sensational. Everyone there offered their opinions on restaurants, tours, activities, shopping... they were all great! Here's a hot tip: there are 22 restaurants that will deliver to the Kensington Park! You never have to leave the hotel. I have a photograph of my wife lounging on a couch in our suite, looking like the cat who ate the canary! It's one of my favorite pictures of all time. The Kensington Park Hotel was instrumental in the formation of a relationship that led to a great marriage and I will always look fondly on our days and nights there. While we haven't been back since, I am very happy to hear that the service and style of this grand San Francisco treat haven't changed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful beds, great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: alshakesby
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing, it is so central. The room was lovely but very small, 2 double beds and two sets of luggage left no room to swing a cat. En suite was good though and very importantly, the room was always clean. Beds were fantastic, we could have brought them home with us if possible! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service, Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kensington Park for a week at the end of August for our 15th Anniversary. We arrived early and they let us in immediately which was very much appreciated given we had an early flight in cramped quarters. I have never stayed at a place where the concierge was as helpful or knowledgeable as this hotel. The location can't be beat. It was within a 30 second walk of Union Square. There were plenty of good (not great) restaurants near by. Be forewarned though - if you don't want a view of the parking lot, bring ear plugs. This part of the city never seems to sleep and the windows are only single pane. If you're good with this as we were, then by all means stay here. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay, I would give anything around Union Square a pass. The hotel was clean, the maid service prompt and professional and beds just divine. There is an entire Edwardian meets modern flair about the hotel that I just loved.

Reviews.Title: “Great start”
Reviews.Author: TwoofOz
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our first visit to the USA. If first impressions are important, this hotel ticks the right boxes. I've given it (only) four stars because we did enjoy some outstanding b&bs in Britain but we would have no qualms in recommending this to anyone. It may not be the newest hotel in town but it is wonderfully atmospheric and is beautifully located. You won't be disappointed. As a bonus, there's a very good value diner, for breakfast, just a couple of doors up.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: CornwallS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington for the end of our Honeymoon and couldn't have chosen a better place. The staff were great, and we even had our room upgraded for the occasion. Although not huge, the room was luxurious with a fantastically comfy bed and a really well set up bathroom. We loved our stay here and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: charlotte b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Union Square. Convenient for shopping and transport but lacking nice bars in the area. These are within 15-20 min walk away though. We had a corner room on the 10th floor with fantastic views over the city. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The bathroom fine, but a little small. Apparently this is the case for all corner rooms due to the layout. It was still more than adequate though and the views are worth the slightly smaller bathroom. Staff were very friendly and a business centre with printers available which was useful for checking into your flight or doing some last minute San Fran research. I would definitely recommend staying here, especially for couples. The hotel was romantic, friendly and a bit different from the massive international chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobandmaggie
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Kensington which was wasy for walking distance to Nob Hill, Union Square, Little Italy and China Town. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: wastewar
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this property. Super location, comfortable and well appointed rooms with staff who were of help at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: notlostyet36
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5-night stay here. The hotel was quiet and the beds are so comfy! The staff was friendly and helpful, and we loved that sherry was provided in the afternoons. We had two rooms on upper floors, at the back of the hotel. Our views were great and there was no street noise. The rooms are not large, but quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: yusil
Reviews.Content: There are few good things about the hotel. First and foremost is the LOCATION. It is near to almost majority of the must-sees in SF. Union Square is just a few steps away, Market Street for affordable shopping is also just a walking distance. For the lovers of branded and/or high-end boutiques, KPH is the ideal place to stay. Just walk down/up Post Street and the areas surrounding Union Square. Second on the list is SERVICE, specifically the front desk. They're very helpful and polite. I specifically would like to complement a male staff who delivered a complimentary sherry to my room even if it is already a few minutes past the "complimentary sherry/tea time". He saw me slumped on the elevator seat as I was so exhausted at that time coming in from work with a really heavy bag. Kudos, you made my day! Internet in the room is fast and hassle-free. Now the BUTs... the room is quite small. Since I am traveling alone, I stayed in a single room but compared to other hotels in Asia (which is good for one/two), my room is really small. There is not enough space to move around. Also, there is no safety deposit box. You need to go to the front desk to deposit your valuables. There is no refrigerator in the room where I stayed either. I am not sure if this is dependent on the type of room but majority of hotels do have mini refrigerators. If you want to order food and have it delivered to your room, you need to order from the outside restaurants and you have to do it before 7pm. They don't have their own restaurant (apart from Farallon I guess) and they don't have the room+breakfast arrangement. You really need to go out in order to eat. Not a problem though as there are a lot of restaurants adjacent and surrounding the hotel. This is a good hotel to stay in if you're visiting for only a few days, otherwise, it's better if you rent an apartment instead, that is if your staying for at least three weeks or more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MalibuGirl1982
Reviews.Content: This is a good alternative to the Hyatt and St. Francis. The rooms were clean and neat and the front desk very helpful. There is wireless. Views vary on your room location and floor. There is no air conditioning -- not as unusual as you might think since it rarely gets really warm in Union Square. The hotel has a neighboring bar with food and Morton's Steak House within 2 doors. I also took a quick 1.5 block walk to replace a forgotten toothbrush/paste at CVS. All the great stores and shops are near. One of my favorite restaurants, Gitane, is about a 6 block stroll. I stayed here and walked to a convention at the Moscone. Totally doable in comfortable shoes...

Reviews.Title: “Fun San Francisco Trip”
Reviews.Author: vge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel on a recent trip to San Francisco. I traveled with my teenagers and some friends. We loved the location of this boutique hotel. Easy walking distance to many sights in the city. This hotel was built a long time ago and has so many wonderful old historic features in the architecture. The one thing that stood out to all of us was the staff. From the front desk to the housekeeping,everyone went out of there way to make sure you had all you needed. The Housekeeping staff always said hello and to have a wonderful day. Always with a great big smile. Really you felt the warmth of the whole staff. Our rooms were small but very nice and clean. It was more of a boutique hotel and that is what we wanted. They had free coffee in the morning upstairs as well as the lobby. We liked that . I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: lazychocolate
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms via Expedia, and were asked if we wanted to upgrade upon check-in for an extra US$20/night. Taking into account all the reviews commenting about noise, we seized the opportunity immediately. They were kind enough to put us in opposite rooms so it was really convenient for us. We were on the 10th floor and had completely different experiences in terms of noise. I had a room with a view (I was looking at Nob Hill, I think it is? Can't remember), but at times it was really noisy - seems like the people in the streets were celebrating after some game or something. My parents, on the other hand, were facing buildings upon buildings but had it better. It was quieter, which was good for them. The rooms are comfortable, the toilet is relatively spacious compared to some other hotels we've been to, and the bedside tables were nice - there was a pull-out compartment for you to do some writing on and things like that. And of course, there's free wifi. It surprised me while searching for rooms in SFO that there'd be places without it - I assumed it was a given. Oh well .... Location is good - Morton's is a few doors down and Union Sq is genuinely nearby, within a block's walking distance. We found out later we were fortunate to have booked Kensington Park - my uncle, a local, told us that other hotels claim to be near Union Square but are actually 6-7 blocks away and are in the Tenderloin (not a district you want to be in especially if you have young children). Overall a good experience; I wouldn't mind going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: AsafPol Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right on union square just next to a cable car stop. staff was very helpful. paid just 160$ per night which was a great price for this hotel. the room was great, big and spacious, Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Mhjort
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in August 2011, and really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are a good size, there is plenty of closet space, and a big dresser for all your clothes. The bathroom was an okay size, with a great counter for your stuff. And most important of all it was spotless clean. We didn't really use any of the hotel services, only when we ordered a cab for the airport, and they made sure we got that on time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nuccisr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near the cable car lines and the shopping for major dept stores. The rooms are older and bathrooms very small and not renovated. Nothing like the pictures on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - very central”
Reviews.Author: Julia T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were not overly impressed. While the hotel was located very centrally at Union Square, we found the rooms fairly old and small. The hotel did not have any aircon and the room was a little stuffy at night. The front desk staff were not overly friendly. The room we stayed in also didn't have a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jadib
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right down the street from Union Square. Very close to shopping, restaurants, and local transportation (trolley, bus, bart). The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is old and still has a lot of the old character, but is well updated. The rooms and bathrooms are very small, but were just fine for the two of us. Considering the area, it was very quiet at night when we went to bed. The one complaint I have (which really isn't a big deal), is that I was surprised the guys working at the front door (valets?) never opened the door for us. We didn't have dinner at the attached restaurant, but sat in the bar for happy hour with discounted appetizers and wine. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice oasis after long day of touristing”
Reviews.Author: ARL2601
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park Hotel is one block from Union Square, and while the area can be busy / loud day and night (think smaller version of Times Square) we heard absolutely no noise. Get area to pick up a bus or (if you must, cable car) and the BART is about 5-6 blocks south with direct access to the SFO airport. The building is older with lots of character and is well maintained. An Elks lodge and ballroom still exist on one of the floors. Our room was spotless and very cozy feeling. I really liked the ceiling light/fan which created mellow and romantic light. We both agreed the bed was great for a hotel, including soft sheets. View was mostly the side of another building, I don't think many rooms have a great view here, but that's what you go out for during the day! All the staff we encountered were professional, helpful, and friendly. Did not try the adjacent restaurant, but can recommend Sakana two blocks down at 605 Post for late night sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place”
Reviews.Author: txtrav61
Reviews.Content: Loved the atmosphere and location. Very comfortable with a gracious, accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: ATXJudie
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco for a get-away from the summer heat and spent three nights at The Kensington Park Hotel. The location was great, right next to Union Square. The cable car pick-up (touristy, but fun) was right at the corner and it was an easy ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Although a long walk, we actually were able to walk back from the Wharf (through North Beach and Chinatown). The room was comfortable and a good size. There is no air conditioning, but with the weather we were fine. It was a little noisy with the window open, so we would leave it open until we were ready to sleep and shut it. We were still comfortable at night. The service was excellent, giving us tips for getting around, riding the cable car, and getting us to the airport in the easiest/cheapest way the last day we were there. Overall I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very quiet and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LBrock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and found it to be ideal for exploring San Francisco. There are a couple of department stores nearby, I walked to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and it was an easy bus ride to Golden Gate Park from a nearby stop. Chinatown is a short stroll away. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the area. The front desk staff were most helpful when I had questions about trams and buses and helped me book a tour of Alcatraz (I recommend the evening one). The room was quiet, clean and the bed very comfortable. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileNJ
Reviews.Content: My third time staying at this hotel for San Francisco sightseeing and getting together with local friends. I was upgraded to a large room this time, which made it even more pleasant. The housekeeping service is great and unobtrusive. Comfortable beds, cozy lobby, nice views from upper floors. But although everything in the bathroom works fine, maybe it's time they upgraded the fittings (faucets, sinks, shower doors, etc). However, even if they didn't I'd likely return. The value can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: brucekwg
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good stuff. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. I felt like the pictures were taken with the largest room that they have. I was in a cramped shoe box like room. NO A/C in this hotel. This is not normally an issue, but they should tell you. The outside noise was LOUD and hard to sleep. I swear the garbage man starts work at 2am and goes till 6 am, 2 nights in a row. NO COUNTER space in the bathroom. All you have is a sink, to say the bedroom is small, the bathroom is even smaller. All I can say is save your money and I wish someone had been honest before me! No restaurant on site. NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “It has charm, friendly staff, and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: homebody18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in June 2011. I would definitely return to stay again, as it was a great value. We asked for a quiet room away from the elevators, with a view and our request was granted. Our room was clean with updated decor. Even though it was small, it felt luxurious. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom and closet both spacious. We loved having a mini-fridge, free wi-fi, and a working window, so we could let in a breeze when we came back from trekking around the city. The staff was very helpful in giving us tourist advice. The hotel has a fabulous location off Union Square. We had no car and didn't need one because we were close to all kinds of public transportation, and we could walk many places, including the Museum of Modern Art. We had a delicious late dinner around the corner at Sears Fine Food, with fast service and a cozy atmosphere. We really enjoyed our stay at Kensington Park Hotel and recommend it highly to anyone who doesn't want to spend their whole budget on accommodations but who wants a decent, comfortable place in a safe and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Aiming to please.”
Reviews.Author: oneoftheds
Reviews.Content: I arrived before the appointed check-in time. They unloaded our luggage and stated our room was not ready but they would show us an upgraded corner room that had 2 windows and better beds. It was a lovely room from where I could see Union Square. The desk clerk, concierge, and the housekeeping staff were very polite and helpful. Best of all there were no bed bugs! (I checked with bedbugregistry.com before booking and again before I left for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location and the awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: Dflerk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a the KP on my last few stays to SF. So many hotels to choose from, so when I find a good one, I write about it! Great staff, location and rooms. The beds, after a 20+ travel time from Singapore, are worth every penny. Union Square just out the door. Great places to eat in every direction. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We found a gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen029
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in SF. Previously stayed in a much bigger hotel....enjoyed our experience at KP so much more. Its a beautifully restored old hotel whose rooms have been very elegantly updated. Loved that it is a smaller hotel (less crowded, better service), loved the location on Union Square close to cable cars and shopping, and the staff are amazing. Every evening soothing saxaphone music wafted up to our 11th flr room....turns out it was street musicians on Union Square....delightful!!! Be sure to join the Personality Perks Club when you book. We did and upon arrival found we had been given a free room upgrade. As for the staff, never seen such caring and responsive employees. One evening we returned around 7pm, hungry, tired and craving Mexican food. Desk staff recommended Colibri and called to make a reservation for 8:15. Good thing, as there was nothing else available till 10pm. That made our evening, and the restaurant was great. Beware there is no onsite parking. Valet takes your vehicle to a garage blocks away. We could have asked for it at any time, but were happy to use transit the whole time. Its a great way to see the neighbourhoods. The highlight of our trip was a tour of Alcatraz Island. The views of SF are amazing, and the tour of the prison is fascinating. We would definitely stay at KP again because it was excellent value for downtown SF, and an absolute delight to return to every evening, One day we arrived back early just so we could enjoy afternoon sherry in the gorgeous lobby.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Yedmondale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park for 4 nights in June. Rooms were excellent and the staff extremely helpful. Bob, Rueben and Giovanni gave great advice and helped make for a great stay. The hotel doesn't do food but, as you're literally in the middle of everywhere, it's very easy to eat well. Sears, around the corner, is famous for it's breakfasts (don't be put-off by the queue) and there's an amazing little cafe next door that does a mini take-away breakfast. Try the excellent 'Fino', 1 minute walk from the hotel, for a superb evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm”
Reviews.Author: SKNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four (9 and 14 yo) in one of the royal queen suites. Best beds of the whole trip, great view over Nob hill and the most friendliest staff. Was told at Fishermans wharf no tickets to Alcatraz available for the next four days, spoke to the Concierge @ the hotel and got the family there two days later, also was able to get us a Yosemite trip with less than 12 hrs notice. Right next to Union square and cable tram stop. Whilst no breakfast has fresh coffee each morning and great sherry and tea in the evening in the beautiful lobby. Minor point no fridge in room so have to finish the drinks each night (not to much of a problem).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite San Francisco boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn1243
Reviews.Content: From the minute the valet takes your car till he returns, the service was terrific and on a holiday week-end too. Spacious rooms and very comfortable beds made the brief stay most relaxing. It was the little touches: Plenty of info on the City's happenings, Iced lemon water at all times in the lobby, Sherry at 5pm, and welcome munchies in the room made you feel safely at home. Would definitely return for the theatre nearby or Christmas shopping. Melita from San Jose

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bekeles
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the hotel, I knew it was going to be a magical stay. The hotel was founded in the early 1920's and they have really done a great job to maintain that sense of old-time class. They had complimentary tea and coffee every morning from 8-10am as well as tea and sherry in the lobby in the late afternoon (which was delightful cap after a day out in Napa valley). The location is great; right off of union square with great access to public transportation, and shopping! The rooms are adorable (I was in one of the smaller ones), the beds are extremely comfortable, and the toiletries are great (green tea). Most importantly, the staff at the front desk and the concierge are extremely helpful and friendly. Hands down, next time I'm in SF, I will certainly stay at the Kensington.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: doctorjo
Reviews.Content: Service from everyone in this hotel was warm, polite, and not intrusive at all. My room, with a king bed on the 7th floor, was clean and had all the amenities, including a small desk. Being able to walk to the corner and catch the cable car or cross diagonally to Union Square Park was so convenient! The only negative was that one of the two elevators was out of service my whole stay, but it didn't add too much time on to getting to and from my room.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: SuekBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 5 night at the Kensongton Park Hotel in San Fran. The rooms was spotless, bed very very comfy - and the staff were fantastic! Overall a wonderful stay and would definately recommend and return! Great job Kensington Park!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonesHouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, Beds are comfortable, Good Amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin7410
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value! Itâ€™s right by Union Square, near tons of shopping and food options. The hotel is older, but the dÃ©cor is updated and very nice. The bed is VERY comfortable â€“ made it hard to get up in the morning. There was a large flat screen TV (as you can see in the pics online), and we had no trouble hooking up the DVD player we brought with us. The standard room is pretty small, but Iâ€™m sure you can expect that in any downtown location. The only real challenge was figuring out where to store our suitcases that was out of the way. We ended up stacking them in the floor of the closet. I was a little worried about not having A/C (being from TX), but it was rarely warm in the room and opening the window solved that right away. We were on the 6th floor and didnâ€™t have any trouble with noise at night except for a trumpet player in Union Square. He was a talented guy, but one night I had a little trouble getting to sleep around 10:30 or so because of it. Not the hotelâ€™s fault, though. Maybe being on a higher floor would have helped. Itâ€™s not a very far walk to the train station/cable car turnaround at Market St. We arrived pretty early (around 10AM) and they were very accommodating. Our room wasnâ€™t ready yet, so they switched us to a different room so that we could go ahead and check in. We had requested a fridge and apparently they had already put it in the other room that wasnâ€™t clean yet, so the front desk clerk asked for it to be moved. It was in our new room before we even made it up there! One day we wanted to try the sherry available in the afternoon, but we were a few minutes late. They kept it out for us so that we could try it. They also were able to help us with several general recommendations (best place to grab a quick bite late at night, etc). Seems like they have a great staff at this hotel. We really enjoyed staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler0621
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to cable car and bus lines. Room is a little small, but I expected that. Very comfortable bed and pillows. No problems at all! Very friendly front desk and within walking distance to eating and shopping. We enjoyed our stay and would love to stay again if we return to San Francisco. Got a great deal on easyclicktravel, so couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, cute rooms... the front desk staff could use a minor upgrade”
Reviews.Author: SungirlFlorida
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay at the Kensington Park hotel after much research (months in advance). We chose this hotel primarily for the location and proximity to all major destinations. I requested an early check in and was accomodated (which was lovely as I had endured a 9 hour travel day from the East coast). Immediately I walked the perfectly safe block to the center of Union Square. So much shopping, restaurants and very close to the Gold Dust Lounge - which was frequented daily (sometimes twice). We also were able to walk through Chinatown and into the North Beach area - then on to Lombard Street and down to Fisherman's wharf - lovely day of walking - the weather was fantastic!... We didn't use any public transportation but it would have been easy to get where we needed to go. Cabs were plentiful in the area. The rooms were on the smallish side but it was exactly as I would have expected (actually a bit more roomy). The hotel had a vintage flair - very cute... a lot of personality. The housekeeping staff and handymen walking around the hotel were always very friendly and personable. The front desk staff did not seem familiar with the area AT ALL (horrible restaurant recommendation - KULETO'S - don't bother) and were not overly helpful. My husband called down on the last night of our stay to request hot water to the room - it never came. Overall the stay was amazing... nice, clean rooms and great location. To be noted: it was an unusually warm week (70-80) and we were thrilled that we had a ceiling fan (apparently hard to come by in SF). We got a great rate for the area - can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: p00kies
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Kensington Park for 3 nights at the beginning of June. I had booked this after reading the great reviews it had received on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The location is fantastic, I don't think you could get more central. Right on Union Square we saved so much money on taxis. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, we tried Mortons Steakhouse which is almost next door and the Daily Grill do a good breakfast just a couple of streets away. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable with a bed to die for! Modern bathroom, big flat screen tv, iron and ironing board provided and a great city view, what more could we ask for! What we liked most about this hotel is the fact that it had oodles of character, from the piano in the foyer to the decorative elevator doors, we just loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “To quote the governator "we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: colleen93
Reviews.Content: 1. Location - we couldn't have found a better location as it was close to transportation (Hop on Hop off buses and cable cars), Union Square,restaurants, entertainment and great shopping 2. Hotel environment - lots of character, well maintained, clean and comfortable rooms 3. Hotel staff - from the cleaning, maintenance to the front desk staff, they couldn't have have been more helpful and made us feel that they wanted us there. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the best staff I have ever encountered!!”
Reviews.Author: daniellelouise32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during for our first time in San Francisco. The hotel is centrally located to everything you need. We stayed in a twin room that was very clean and very nicely decorated. It was a bit on the small size but was comfy and sufficient for us. The bathroom is also a good size. The only problem that we had was the noise on the street at night so double glazing would be a good idea but it wasn't a big problem. The staff were the most courteous and helpful that I have ever encountered in any hotel especially Bob the concierge, he really helped us out on a number of occasions. In all we had really enjoyable, comfortable stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it!! Also the free tea and coffee in the morning plus the free sherry in the evening was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodie1416
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend on our vacation to San Francisco. We are in our late twenties, and I do have to say I sometimes felt as if I was being looked down upon by some of the front staff, or maybe it was just the fact that the concierge never seemed to smile. Housekeeping and other staff were very friendly though. Overall clean, you could tell it was an older building though. Curtains in the room had cobwebs and there was brown gunk (spilled pop?) all over the frame of the mirror in the room, but otherwise great. Probably the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in--great pillows and everything! Bathroom: the glass shower door spilled water, flooding the floor after every shower; no ventilation fan. We requested a non-street side view so we would have less noise, and it seemed to work (despite the unsightly view of the alley, but hey). The business center was nice to print things (like our boarding passes) except one computer was broken and the printer constantly jammed. We notified the front desk but when we checked on our last day, nothing was fixed. They will provide an in-room mini fridge and coffee maker upon request, which was a must have for us. The best part was the location--right on Union Square which is always bustling with action and shopping. Just steps from the trolleys and buses (by the way, take the buses everywhere--very cheap!). We weren't in the hotel often, but when we did come in from sightseeing it was pleasant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tanyasworld
Reviews.Content: We had the best time ever visiting san francisco and staying at the kensington:-) The staff was amazing and extremely helpful. The rooms are very comfy cozy and clean. We will def be back:-)

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: debbiecam
Reviews.Content: I found great respite at the Kensington the rooms were classy and the staff was warm and friendly. The accessibility to great restaurants and shopping was excellent! It was a little too windy outside, but who can control the weather. It was a wonderful stay in San Francisco, and I highly recommending The Kensington to all!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a nice hotel, with a slightly disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Missus2009
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park Hotel was just past Union Square, and so was a great location for tourists, being close to the sightseeing bus and cable car stops. The hotel itself looked very impressive when you entered the lobby and the staff were very friendly and helpful. In comparison, our room was a bit small and dark, and a little rough around the edges. However, as we were not planning to spend much time there due to our busy sightseeing schedule, this was not a problem and the room was perfectly comfortable and clean. The double shower was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, what else do you need??”
Reviews.Author: jessjohnson23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kensington Park with my mom earlier this month. You couldn't ask for a better location, you can walk pretty much walk anywhere you'd want to go for shopping, eating, and you're just seconds from Union Square. The front desk staff was so helpful and friendly, with great restaurant recommendations (try House of Prime Rib for an amazing slab of beef!). They serve sherry in the lobby in the afternoons which was fun, especially to give your feet a rest and admire the beautifully painted ceiling. There are no restrooms in the lobby which is a little inconvenient , so plan on that before you leave your room. Overall I love the KP and will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: CorinneLagonigro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel in San Fran in May-June 2008 despite my stay being listed below as June 2010...TA didn't give me an option for anything older. I would have written a review sooner, but never seemed to have the time so here it goes. I really liked the Kensington Park Hotel. The lobby was old fashioned and quite nice. I believe they served tea and sherry in the lobby at 4:00 in the afternoon on a daily basis as well. The front desk staff were very nice to us during our stay. The rooms were modern with flat screen tv's and comfortable king beds. We had a higher floor so noise on the street didn't bother us. Bathrooms were small, but clean, and amenities were replaced daily. Rooms were also on the smaller size, however, this is a boutique hotel and that is expected. Besides if you are in San Fran you should only be in your room to nap from time to time and get a good nights sleep so room size shouldn't be an issue. Actually, I live outside of New York City and I can safely say that it costs us more money for a room half the size of the Kensington's rooms when we are back home. The thing I enjoyed the most about the hotel though was the location. It is half a block from Union Square! It's literally down the street. Besides that, it is around the corner from Sear's Fine Foods where you will get an amazing breakfast-especially the swedish pancakes with boysenberry jam. To die for! Just make sure you get there early (before 8 a.m.) or you will have a very long wait to eat. Other places I recommend to eat are Ghiardhelli's for dessert, Max's on the Square (right around the block) for dinner, Boudine's on Fisherman's Wharf for dinner, In n Out Burger anytime you can get your hands on it and Carabou Coffee for some extra energy. Stay away from Mel's Diner! I know, I know, it's so nostalgic with the milk shakes and the pictures from American Graffiti, but the food is terrible. I had roast chicken that was so dry I couldn't even eat it and my husband had a chicken pot pie that had a chicken leg bone baked into it. Needless, to say we didn't go back. And don't listen to the parking lot guys down at Fisherman's wharf that tell you to eat at Aliotto's. Not only was the food overpriced and inedible, but the staff were beyond rude. Shame we gave them any of our money when Boudine's is a thousand times better! As for a siteseeing tip- Go to the Alcatraz night tour. It's only on Thursday nights and it fills up fast. We booked our tickets five months in advance! Make sure you wear sneakers there too because you walk uphill for a fair amount of time once you get there. Also, if you want to rent a car (there is a fee for parking at the hotel) there are two rental car places within a couple of blocks. We rented a car at Avis and had a blast going to Napa, San Jose, Santa Rosa, Sonoma and Muir Woods...all worth the travel time. Plus, it's great to drive over the bridge and have breakfast in Sausalito. I would without a doubt stay at the Kensington Park Hotel again because of it's great location, cleanliness and affordability.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: Mystelody
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel to attend an event around Union Square. The location was perfect for me - close to shopping and a 2 min walk to Union Sq. The front desk staff were welcoming, courteous and very helpful. The rooms and bathroom are more spacious than your average SF hotel. They weren't sparkling clean but then again, this is not a 5 star hotel and I am one of those people who care about the fact that the towels are not all the same shade of white. In addition to the regular toiletries, toothpaste is provided so that's a plus. And a fridge - another plus for people staying long term. There was absolutely no drinking/bottled water in the room. Not even for purchase! And the vending machine in the ice-supply room does not carry water either. Just soda. The afternoon sherry tasted pretty good :-) There was a lot (and I mean a lot) of street noise at about 1 AM from people who were partying. Not the hotel's fault though. Overall, I was not disappointed and for me, that is a very good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to SF yet!”
Reviews.Author: cocosfriend
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Kensington Park. My first say "in" Union Square, and I loved it! Fabulous history and food. And the Kensington Park was spot on! From the top notch service, to the ample sized room. With the window open a bit, the sleeping weather was perfect and during the day you could sometimes hear the click-clack of the trolley and its bell in the distance! The Kensington is a tremendous location for all of you SF sights!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm with Amenities Galore”
Reviews.Author: Coco012
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park immediately stood out with friendly staff throughout, starting at the front door! Every employee we encountered strove to positively represent this hotel. Our room was quiet when the window was closed, yet we could be reminded that we were near vibrant Union Square when we opened the window slightly . . . a cool San Francisco breeze embelished quaintly with the occasional toll of a streetcar bell. The Kensington Park's inviting lobby was a nice place for a chat with an old friend. We were within convenient walking distance to great restaurants, museums, and shopping areas, and the front desk staff was eager to suggest their favorites when asked. We will certainly return to this gem in beautiful San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Wow should be 5 star”
Reviews.Author: noodledoo
Reviews.Content: Wow, had a great time. Upgraded to top floor and worth every penny. Staff excellent and could not do enough to help. Great location and will be coming back again soon. Loved it and the place. Could not find one fault and coffee in the morning worth trying on the 10th floor.....

Reviews.Title: “"Incredibly comfortable stay at the Kensington Park Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: medward086
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Kensington Park. The hotel was easy to find, conveniently located near Union Square. Although, I wish the valet had been easier (waiting time can be a bit long, so plan ahead). The lobby was as inviting as the friendly staff. My room had beautiful views of San Francisco's downtown and a very comfortable bed! Great staff, perfect location, and reasonable rates...Coming just from Sacramento I know where I'll be staying on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm tucked amid the hubbub”
Reviews.Author: vermonsters2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park for our 25th wedding anniversary and it was the perfect place! The personnel were all professional and efficient. We had a welcoming bottle of wine, bottled water, and lovely bathrobes to help us settle in on our "mink" bed throws, which are the icing on the cake to some incredibly comfortable beds. The bathroom was spacious, well lit and the shower had great water pressure and seemingly unlimited hot H2O. The owner graciously phoned us to congratulate us on our anniversary. The KP has a lovely european feel, for those who prefer not to be in cookie cutter style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable value hotel for downtown San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: SebGo
Reviews.Content: Good location, convenient to the San Francisco business district, Embarcadero, Union Square, shopping, etc. Quiet (enough) room, and comfortable. The place is s a little worn around the edges, sort of like an old English Guest House, but very comfortable and clean. Try the cafe next door (La Taza) for fantastic (and inexpensive) breakfast burritos and espresso.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: Chinabob-badi
Reviews.Content: I loved the historic Kensington Park Hotel. Well kept from the closet in the room to the lobby, where Afternoon Tea was observed. The staff were very helpful and easy to find.The bed was comfortable, the room offered great views of the city, even a glimpse of the bay. I recommend The Kensington Park with highest confidence and it has certainly become my hotel of choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, with great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: fowlerc
Reviews.Content: First time in San Fransico, my sister set up the trip including staying at the Kensington. It was great. There were a few minor glitches but when we informed the front desk they were delt with immediately. The room was great. The beds were extremely comfortable and being able to open the window was a big plus. The location was great, a short trip to the warf, around the corner to Union Square and an easy walk to China Town. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, needs a little attention”
Reviews.Author: bjparker
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our stay, but there were a few things that needed attention - getting a little faded around the edges. Free internet was very slow - and they tried to sell a higher speed service which was a bit annoying - either give free internet or don't. But, all in all worth the money so recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that represents the charm of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location half a block away from Union Square and approximately 30 min walk from SOMA and Fishermans Wharf. Hotel was charming and quirky, pretty foyer, bench seats in elevators, friendly staff. Room was clean and bed comfortable. Several items provided free of charge in the bathroom (ie. razor, toothpaste etc. on top of the standard shampoo/conditioner which was useful.) Yes, the place probably needs to be painted again and the window didn't close but there is an old world charm about the hotel and personally I liked the fact that the windows opened! (No recycled air!!) You can hear the trolleys in the street which made me feel like a part of the city. (Would probably annoy a light sleeper though.) Overall good value!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant historic hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: JeremyInFairfax
Reviews.Content: Great staff - very helpful. Great location, just a block from Union Square. Small-ish lobby has some interesting architectural features, but needs some sprucing up. Pros of the sleeping rooms: nice sized, very comfortable bed, free Internet service, lots of amenities in the bathroom.
